Package mazePD

Class Maze

java.lang.Object
mazePD.Maze
public class Maze extends Object
Maze is a public class that represents a maze. The maze is a 3D collection of cells. Each cell contains one of these values: EMPTY - this space is empty and a droid is allowed to occupy this cell BLOCK - this space is full (wall) and a droid is not allowed to occupy this cell PORTAL_DN - this space contains a portal to a lower level, a droid is allowed to occupy this cell PORTAL_UP - this space contains a portal to a upper level, a droid is allowed to occupy this cell END - - this space contains the exit, a droid is allowed to occupy this cell The maze is oriented where: each level of the maze is number(z) 0 (top) to depth-1(bottom) each level is a grid of cells where x=0 and y=0 is the top left cell. Movement in the maze made by direction where: D00 - decrease y D180 - increase y D90 - increase x D270 - decrease x UP - decrease z DN - increase z
Author:
(David North)

      Parameters:
      mazeDim - - the dimension for a level of the maze
      mazeDepth - - the depth of the maze (number of levels)
      mode - - NORMAL (random maze), TEST (same maze every time)

    • move

      public mazePD.Coordinates move(mazePD.DroidInterface droid, Maze.Direction direction)
      move() move the droid one cell in the indicated direction: D00 - decrease y D180 - increase y D90 - increase x D270 - decrease x UP - decrease z DN - increase z if the cell the droid wants to move to contains BLOCK or outside the maze then the droid remains in its current location and does not move
      Parameters:
      droid - DroidInterface - a droid that is in the maze
      direction - Direction - the direction the droid wants to move
      Returns:
      Coordinates - coordinates of the droid's current location in maze
